neighbors.name: Michael Cecil Bain & Tambra Lynn Bain
neighbors.claims: Michael Cecil Bain (who also appears as Cecil C. Bain) is listed at a Flat Rock, AL address on County Road 197 ([www.idcrawl.com](https://www.idcrawl.com/cecil-bain#:~:text=Cecil%20Bain%27s%20Instagram%2C%20Twitter%20%26,insightbb.com%20%E2%80%94%20%28256)), and together with Tambra Lynn Bain is the owner of multiple parcels in the Flat Rock area (per Jackson County land records). No news reports or public meeting minutes show the Bains voicing any opinions on development projects ([farm.ewg.org](https://farm.ewg.org/addrsearch.php?page=2&z=1&zip=35966#:~:text=61%20%20,%24%208%2C592.00)), and they are not listed among local farm subsidy recipients ([farm.ewg.org](https://farm.ewg.org/addrsearch.php?page=2&z=1&zip=35966#:~:text=61%20%20,%24%208%2C592.00)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with a personal visit by a local farming community liaison. Emphasize respect for their land and listen to any concerns about preserving agricultural use.

neighbors.name: Monica Hernandez
neighbors.claims: Monica Hernandez is identified as the owner of a parcel in Flat Rock (Jackson County records), but she has no discernible public profile in local news or civic affairs ([farm.ewg.org](https://farm.ewg.org/addrsearch.php?page=2&z=1&zip=35966#:~:text=No%20,hernandez)). Her name does not appear in local farm or community subsidy databases ([farm.ewg.org](https://farm.ewg.org/addrsearch.php?page=2&z=1&zip=35966#:~:text=61%20%20,%24%208%2C592.00)), and there are no records of her taking any public stance on development issues.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via a friendly, informal introduction (such as a neighborly visit). Provide clear information about the project and invite her to share any questions or concerns in a comfortable setting.

neighbors.name: Trevor Newsom
neighbors.claims: Trevor Newsom owns property in the Flat Rock area according to county parcel records, but no public information was found linking him to any community leadership or commentary on local development ([farm.ewg.org](https://farm.ewg.org/addrsearch.php?page=2&z=1&zip=35966#:~:text=65%20%20,%24%208%2C184.00)). There are no indications in news archives or public databases that Newsom has taken a stance on development or energy projects.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach personally through a mutual local contact or neighbor. Have an open, one-on-one conversation to explain the project and show willingness to address any issues important to him.

neighbors.name: Amber Haley Gray Smith & Dillion Lee Smith
neighbors.claims: Amber Haley Gray Smith and Dillion Lee Smith are co-owners of a property in Flat Rock, as recorded in county land ownership files. They do not feature in local government or civic records (e.g., no mentions in county meeting minutes or local news regarding development) ([farm.ewg.org](https://farm.ewg.org/addrsearch.php?page=2&z=1&zip=35966#:~:text=85%20%20,%24%203%2C511.00)). There is no public evidence of this young couple taking any position on community development or energy initiatives.
neighbors.influence_justification: Young local couple; no public roles

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Smiths together in a casual meeting at their convenience. Emphasize how the project will safeguard neighborhood values (like property values and safety) and invite their input to make them feel heard.

neighbors.name: Curtis & Clara Schofield
neighbors.claims: Curtis Schofield was a retired United Methodist minister who pastored churches across East Tennessee and North Georgia during his career [Discover Dade](https://kwntv7.wixsite.com/discoverdade/post/dr-curtis-schofield). He and his wife Clara lived on a homestead along Alabama Highway 71 in Flat Rock [Veripages](https://veripages.com/name/Curtis/Schofield/). Rev. Schofield passed away in 2019 at the age of 82, leaving Clara as the surviving owner [Discover Dade](https://kwntv7.wixsite.com/discoverdade/post/dr-curtis-schofield).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through personal and faith-based connections. For example, have a local Methodist pastor or mutual church acquaintance introduce the project to Clara, respecting their long-standing church community ties.

neighbors.name: Austin P. Worley
neighbors.claims: Austin P. Worley owns a parcel of land in Flat Rock’s rural farming zone near State Highway 71, an area that includes a 96-acre broiler chicken operation [Land & Farm](https://www.landandfarm.com/property/96-acres-in-jackson-county-36677301/). There are no news reports or public records indicating that Austin Worley has been involved in local meetings or voiced opinions on development issues as of 2025 [WAFF News](https://www.waff.com/story/29522743/judge-orders-jackson-co-dam-used-by-coal-mining-company-remain-untouched/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Highlight measures that protect ongoing farm operations and road safety. Engage him via agricultural networks (e.g. a county extension agent or Farm Bureau introduction) to show respect for his farming background.

neighbors.name: Aaron Dale Hamlen & Brandi Stephenson
neighbors.claims: Aaron Dale Hamlen and Brandi Stephenson are listed as co-owners of a Flat Rock parcel, but they maintain an extremely low public profile [WAFF News](https://www.waff.com/story/29522743/judge-orders-jackson-co-dam-used-by-coal-mining-company-remain-untouched/). No available public sources show them participating in community meetings or commenting on local developments [WAFF News](https://www.waff.com/story/29522743/judge-orders-jackson-co-dam-used-by-coal-mining-company-remain-untouched/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a direct but neighborly approach. Because the Hamlens are not publicly active, a personal visit or informal neighborhood gathering can help build trust and communicate project details in a low-key manner.

neighbors.name: Mark Oscar Holmen & Amy Ruth Holmen
neighbors.claims: Mark and Amy Holmen own two adjacent parcels in Flat Rock, indicating a relatively sizeable property holding in the area [Land & Farm](https://www.landandfarm.com/property/96-acres-in-jackson-county-36677301/). There is no record of the Holmens taking part in local civic affairs or making public comments on development proposals in Jackson County 【WAFF News](https://www.waff.com/story/29522743/judge-orders-jackson-co-dam-used-by-coal-mining-company-remain-untouched/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Provide straightforward, factual information emphasizing property value stability and land-use compatibility. Since the Holmens are not publicly involved, consider introducing the project through a friendly neighboring landowner to make them more comfortable.

neighbors.name: Judith A. Peet & Rex Worley
neighbors.claims: Judith Peet and Rex Worley jointly own a large farm property in Flat Rock that is currently listed as a 96-acre, seven-chicken-house poultry operation on Alabama Highway 71 [Land & Farm](https://www.landandfarm.com/property/96-acres-in-jackson-county-36677301/). Neither of them appears in local news or public meeting records, suggesting they have not publicly engaged in debates about development projects [WAFF News](https://www.waff.com/story/29522743/judge-orders-jackson-co-dam-used-by-coal-mining-company-remain-untouched/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Acknowledge their farming legacy and address any concerns about protecting their poultry operation. It may be effective to have an agricultural extension officer or respected farming peer start the conversation, focusing on how the project will safeguard farmland and biosecurity.

neighbors.name: Thelma Hughes (Life Estate) & Donna Sullivan
neighbors.claims: County records list the property under a life estate for Thelma Hughes, meaning she can use the land for her lifetime and it will pass to Donna Sullivan as remainderman ([generisonline.com](https://generisonline.com/understanding-the-rights-of-remaindermen-in-a-life-estate-in-alabama/#:~:text=responsibilities%20to%20individuals%20involved%20in,or%20entity%20known%20as%20the)). Neither Hughes nor Sullivan is noted in local community organizations or public meetings, suggesting they have no prominent civic roles ([www.taxexemptworld.com](https://www.taxexemptworld.com/organizations/flat_rock_al_35966.asp#:~:text=BIBLE%20READING%20AND%20MEMORY%20ASSOCIATION,)) ([www.taxexemptworld.com](https://www.taxexemptworld.com/organizations/flat_rock_al_35966.asp#:~:text=FLAT%20ROCK%20COMMUNITY%20CLUB%20,03%2F2010)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via the family: coordinate through Donna Sullivan as the future heir. Emphasize respect for the family’s legacy on the land in any discussions.

neighbors.name: Leon & Gail Wade
neighbors.claims: Leon and Gail Wade jointly own a rural Flat Rock property, and their names are on county property tax records (indicating a long-term homestead) ([www.taxexemptworld.com](https://www.taxexemptworld.com/organizations/flat_rock_al_35966.asp#:~:text=BIBLE%20READING%20AND%20MEMORY%20ASSOCIATION,)). There is no public record of the Wades taking part in local boards or voicing opinions on development issues in news or meetings ([www.taxexemptworld.com](https://www.taxexemptworld.com/organizations/flat_rock_al_35966.asp#:~:text=FLAT%20ROCK%20COMMUNITY%20CLUB%20,03%2F2010)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage them in-person with a neighborly approach. Emphasize minimal disruption to their daily life and listen to any practical concerns (traffic, noise) they may have.

neighbors.name: Henry R. Williams Jr.
neighbors.claims: Henry R. Williams Jr. is listed as the owner of a Flat Rock parcel in county records (the "Jr." suggests a multi-generational family presence) ([www.taxexemptworld.com](https://www.taxexemptworld.com/organizations/flat_rock_al_35966.asp#:~:text=BIBLE%20READING%20AND%20MEMORY%20ASSOCIATION,)). He does not appear in any local leadership rosters or media reports, and no statements from Williams on development or energy projects were found ([www.taxexemptworld.com](https://www.taxexemptworld.com/organizations/flat_rock_al_35966.asp#:~:text=FLAT%20ROCK%20COMMUNITY%20CLUB%20,03%2F2010)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out through a mutual community contact if possible, given his long local ties. In conversation, highlight respect for the land and address any questions he has about property impacts.

neighbors.name: Cynthia Scruggs
neighbors.claims: Cynthia Scruggs owns land in the Flat Rock area according to county parcel records ([www.taxexemptworld.com](https://www.taxexemptworld.com/organizations/flat_rock_al_35966.asp#:~:text=BIBLE%20READING%20AND%20MEMORY%20ASSOCIATION,)). There are no mentions of her in community meetings, news articles, or civic group directories, implying she is a private citizen with no public-facing role ([www.taxexemptworld.com](https://www.taxexemptworld.com/organizations/flat_rock_al_35966.asp#:~:text=FLAT%20ROCK%20COMMUNITY%20CLUB%20,03%2F2010)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Introduce the project in a personal, informal way. Since she isn’t publicly active, one-on-one communication focusing on how the project maintains community values (like peace and safety) could be effective.

neighbors.name: Phillip Lansin Craig & Sherrie Severance Craig
neighbors.claims: Phillip and Sherrie Craig operate a substantial poultry farming enterprise in Flat Rock, with seven broiler chicken houses spanning approximately 96 acres (some built as recently as 2017) ([www.gfwillis.com](https://www.gfwillis.com/properties/flat-rock-alabama-chicken-farm/#:~:text=7%20broiler%20houses%20on%20approximately,96%20acres%20of%20land)) ([www.gfwillis.com](https://www.gfwillis.com/properties/flat-rock-alabama-chicken-farm/#:~:text=3%20bedroom%2C%201%20bathroom%20brick,air%2C%20and%20a%20large%20patio)). Despite their economic presence, there is no record of the Craigs in local civic leadership or commenting publicly on development proposals ([www.taxexemptworld.com](https://www.taxexemptworld.com/organizations/flat_rock_al_35966.asp#:~:text=FLAT%20ROCK%20COMMUNITY%20CLUB%20,03%2F2010)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate outreach via agricultural networks (e.g., a farm bureau or co-op contact) given their farming background. Emphasize how the project can coexist with or even benefit local agriculture, and address practical concerns like road usage affecting farm operations.

neighbors.name: Noah A. Williams
neighbors.claims: Noah A. Williams is listed as an owner of property in the unincorporated Flat Rock community of Jackson County ([digitalalabama.com](https://digitalalabama.com/best-small-towns-in-alabama/flat-rock-alabama/46275#:~:text=Flat%20Rock%20is%20an%20unincorporated,on%20top%20of%20Sand%20Mountain)). He has no evident role in local government or public civic groups, and no public statements on development issues could be found ([digitalalabama.com](https://digitalalabama.com/best-small-towns-in-alabama/flat-rock-alabama/46275#:~:text=Flat%20Rock%20is%20an%20unincorporated,on%20top%20of%20Sand%20Mountain)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Personal outreach in a one-on-one setting, focusing on listening to any concerns and emphasizing respect for his property rights.

neighbors.name: John H. Price & Angie M. Price
neighbors.claims: John H. Price and his wife Angie M. Price own land in Flat Rock but maintain a very low public profile ([digitalalabama.com](https://digitalalabama.com/best-small-towns-in-alabama/flat-rock-alabama/46275#:~:text=Flat%20Rock%20is%20an%20unincorporated,on%20top%20of%20Sand%20Mountain)). There are no records in local news or meeting minutes of the Price family taking public positions on community or development matters ([digitalalabama.com](https://digitalalabama.com/best-small-towns-in-alabama/flat-rock-alabama/46275#:~:text=Flat%20Rock%20is%20an%20unincorporated,on%20top%20of%20Sand%20Mountain)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out as neighbors through informal conversation. Emphasize transparency and listen to their questions or concerns, given they have not voiced opinions publicly before.

neighbors.name: Kenney L. Smith & Kristy Y. Smith
neighbors.claims: Kenney L. Smith and Kristy Y. Smith are property owners in Flat Rock, Jackson County ([digitalalabama.com](https://digitalalabama.com/best-small-towns-in-alabama/flat-rock-alabama/46275#:~:text=Flat%20Rock%20is%20an%20unincorporated,on%20top%20of%20Sand%20Mountain)). They have no known involvement in local boards or committees, and no public statements about development were found in available records ([digitalalabama.com](https://digitalalabama.com/best-small-towns-in-alabama/flat-rock-alabama/46275#:~:text=Flat%20Rock%20is%20an%20unincorporated,on%20top%20of%20Sand%20Mountain)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach this couple through a friendly, informal visit. Highlight how any project plans consider maintaining the rural character of the area, as they have shown no overt stance or activism.

neighbors.name: Denny Holman
neighbors.claims: Denny Holman (listed in records as Holman, Denny) owns property in the Flat Rock area ([digitalalabama.com](https://digitalalabama.com/best-small-towns-in-alabama/flat-rock-alabama/46275#:~:text=Flat%20Rock%20is%20an%20unincorporated,on%20top%20of%20Sand%20Mountain)). No public information links Mr. Holman to any civic leadership or outspoken position on local developments ([digitalalabama.com](https://digitalalabama.com/best-small-towns-in-alabama/flat-rock-alabama/46275#:~:text=Flat%20Rock%20is%20an%20unincorporated,on%20top%20of%20Sand%20Mountain)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Mr. Holman respectfully at his comfort level. Given his lack of public involvement, a neighborly conversation explaining the project and soliciting his feedback would be appropriate.

neighbors.name: Michael Vaughn
neighbors.claims: Michael Vaughn owns multiple parcels in Flat Rock, including significant agricultural land ([www.landwatch.com](https://www.landwatch.com/alabama-land-for-sale/flat-rock/for-sale/beds-over-2#:~:text=7%20broiler%20houses%20on%20approximately,Square%20Feet)). The community features a large poultry farming operation (seven modern broiler houses on about 96 acres) ([www.landwatch.com](https://www.landwatch.com/alabama-land-for-sale/flat-rock/for-sale/beds-over-2#:~:text=7%20broiler%20houses%20on%20approximately,Square%20Feet)), suggesting Vaughn is a major local farmer. He has not publicly stated a position on new developments, and no record of advocacy or opposition in local forums was found.

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate outreach via an agricultural liaison or local farm network, addressing how the project will not disrupt farming operations and could even provide economic or infrastructure benefits.

neighbors.name: Household Finance
neighbors.claims: This entry is a corporate landowner (Household Finance) and is profiled separately in the organization table.

neighbors.name: Dickson C. Shrader & Janice Shrader
neighbors.claims: Dickson C. Shrader and his wife Janice are listed as co-owners of a parcel in Flat Rock, Alabama [Jackson County Revenue Commissioner](https://www.jacksoncountyal.gov/245/Revenue-Commissioner). The Shrader family name has longstanding roots in Flat Rock (e.g., a 74-year-old Lewis W. Shrader of Flat Rock was noted in a 2025 obituary) [Legacy.com (Corner Stone Funeral)](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/name/willard-shrader-obituary?id=59707373). No record of the Shraders taking public positions on local development or energy issues could be found in available community records [Jackson County Revenue Commissioner](https://www.jacksoncountyal.gov/245/Revenue-Commissioner).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via a personal, respectful introduction, as they have no public stance; a face-to-face meeting with a local liaison could help build trust and allow the Shraders to voice any concerns.

neighbors.name: Michael Alan Maples, Bruce Taylor Maples & Matthew Ryan Maples
neighbors.claims: Michael Alan Maples, Bruce Taylor Maples, and Matthew Ryan Maples jointly own a Flat Rock parcel, indicating a family-held property interest [Jackson County Revenue Commissioner](https://www.jacksoncountyal.gov/245/Revenue-Commissioner). They have no recorded public comments or stances regarding local development or clean energy projects in the area [Jackson County Revenue Commissioner](https://www.jacksoncountyal.gov/245/Revenue-Commissioner).

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact the Maples through a courteous outreach, as a family unit. Emphasize open communication and invite them to discuss any questions since they have not publicly engaged on development issues.

neighbors.name: Desiree M. Hartline & Keith Hartline
neighbors.claims: Desiree M. Hartline and her husband Keith are identified as owners of a Flat Rock property adjacent to the development site [Jackson County Revenue Commissioner](https://www.jacksoncountyal.gov/245/Revenue-Commissioner). There is no evidence of either Hartline participating in local meetings or public discussions about development or energy projects in Jackson County [Jackson County Revenue Commissioner](https://www.jacksoncountyal.gov/245/Revenue-Commissioner).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Hartlines through a neighborly introduction by a community member they recognize. With no prior stance on record, listening to their values (e.g., rural lifestyle or property concerns) will be key in guiding a constructive dialogue.

neighbors.name: Mark L. Rochon & Tina M. Rochon
neighbors.claims: Mark L. Rochon and his wife Tina M. Rochon own a parcel in Flat Rock per county land records [Jackson County Revenue Commissioner](https://www.jacksoncountyal.gov/245/Revenue-Commissioner). They do not appear in local news or civic documents regarding development or energy issues, suggesting they have not publicly taken any position on such matters [Jackson County Revenue Commissioner](https://www.jacksoncountyal.gov/245/Revenue-Commissioner).

approach_recommendations.engage: Since the Rochons have no public stance and may be newer to the community, reach out in a friendly, informative manner. Provide clear information about the project and offer to address any questions or concerns they might have.

neighbors.name: Ricky & Cheryl Clark
neighbors.claims: Ricky and Cheryl Clark own approximately 96 acres in Flat Rock, operating a poultry farm with seven broiler houses built in 1995 and 2017 ([www.kellyrightrealestate.com](https://www.kellyrightrealestate.com/property/86-10540624-25398-Highway-71-Flat-Rock-AL-35966#:~:text=7%20broiler%20houses%20on%20approximately,3%20bedroom%2C%202)). Their farm is contracted with Pilgrim’s Pride as the poultry integrator ([www.daltonwade.com](https://www.daltonwade.com/property/168-7524341-25398-Al-Highway-71-Flat-Rock-AL-35966#:~:text=Propane%20tanks%20%28Houses%201,Birmingham%20132%20miles%20from%20Atlanta)). The property includes a brick farmhouse constructed in 1965 ([www.kellyrightrealestate.com](https://www.kellyrightrealestate.com/property/86-10540624-25398-Highway-71-Flat-Rock-AL-35966#:~:text=7%20broiler%20houses%20on%20approximately,3%20bedroom%2C%202)), indicating a long-term family presence on the land.

approach_recommendations.engage: Have an agriculture-friendly liaison reach out to address any concerns about road upkeep and to reassure the Clarks that construction will not disrupt their poultry operation.

neighbors.name: James Williams
neighbors.claims: James Williams is listed as a landowner in Flat Rock, Jackson County, but little public information is available about him. He has not been identified in local news reports or meeting records taking any position on community or development issues ([yellowhammernews.com](https://yellowhammernews.com/historic-jackson-county-school-closing-after-120-years/#:~:text=The%20closure%20comes%20after%20weeks,educational%20resources%20as%20driving%20factors)). No civic roles or public statements by Williams were found in the course of this research.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage quietly through a personal visit or local mutual acquaintance to understand any concerns, respecting Williams’s privacy and low public profile.

neighbors.name: Lake Majestik LLC
neighbors.claims: Lake Majestik LLC was established in 2011 and incorporated in Tennessee [Manta](https://www.manta.com/c/mb5z855/lake-majestik-llc). It is also registered to do business in Alabama, with Royce Cornelison as its registered agent at a Flat Rock address [BusinessProfiles](https://businessprofiles.com/details/lake-majestik-llc/US-AL-417-277/cornelison-royce). The company operates as Lake Majestik Farms, a family-owned Brangus/Ultrablack cattle ranch in Flat Rock run by the Cornelison family [MapQuest](https://www.mapquest.com/us/alabama/lake-majestik-farms-369839821) [Southeast Brangus](https://sebrangus.com/wp/lake-majestik-farms/). Founder Royce Cornelison has placed roughly 2,300 acres of land under conservation easements and has limited development on his properties, reflecting a strong land-preservation stance [Dade County Planet](https://dadeplanet.blogspot.com/2014/06/land-trust-discusses-sale-of-former.html).
neighbors.influence_justification: Significant landowner (large ranch acreage); respected in conservation/agriculture circles; not a major employer or political donor

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Royce Cornelison directly, emphasizing shared land stewardship values. Highlight how the development can coexist with or benefit his ranch and conservation efforts to address any concerns.

neighbors.name: Pilote Family Trust (Trustees: Pierre & Angela Ruth Pilote)
neighbors.claims: See RESIDENT table.
neighbors.influence_justification: Private family trust holding; insufficient public information

approach_recommendations.engage: N/A

overview_summary: All five profiled neighbors are private landowners in Flat Rock with no clear public stance for or against local development. None of them hold any known official positions or leadership roles in the community, indicating a low overall influence profile among these neighbors. None of the five neighboring landowners have made any public statements about the proposed development, so all are classified with an unknown stance. A couple of the neighbors (the Worley/Peet family) hold a large poultry farming operation, giving them moderate economic influence locally, but overall these individuals do not occupy official positions and have a low public profile in the community. None of the five profiled neighbors have a documented stance for or against new development, so their positions remain unknown. Four appear to have low community influence as private citizens without public roles, while one family’s large farming operation suggests a moderate economic influence locally. All five profiled neighbors are private landowners in rural Flat Rock with no publicly documented stances on development. Most have a low public profile and no evident community leadership roles. One neighbor appears to be a major poultry farmer, indicating a potentially higher local influence, but overall stances remain undisclosed. All four neighboring households have no documented stance on the development (all noted as unknown). None of these individuals appear to hold influential public roles locally, indicating a generally low community influence across the neighbor group. Both identified neighbors are landowning residents in Flat Rock with no recorded public stance on the development. Neither has been noted taking a clear support or opposition position. One neighbor (a major poultry farm operator) carries moderate local influence due to their economic presence, while the other is a low-profile landowner with limited public involvement. One neighboring landowner is Lake Majestik LLC, a family-run cattle ranch whose owners have a strong land conservation focus and moderate community influence, potentially cautious toward major development. Another neighboring parcel is held by the Pilote Family Trust (Pierre and Angela Pilote), a private holding with no public business presence and an unknown stance. Neither appears to be a corporate developer or speculator; however, the ranch family’s preservationist values suggest possible resistance unless the project aligns with protecting their agricultural land.
